word: If we would follow the opening providence of God, we should be quick to discern every opening and make the most of every advantage within our reach, to let the light extend and spread to other nations. God, in His providence, has sent men to our very doors and thrust them, as it were, into our arms, that they might learn the truth more perfectly, and be qualified to do a work we could not do in getting the light before men of other tongues. [AT THE TIME THIS WAS WRITTEN, THERE WERE ONLY ABOUT ONE-FOURTH AS MANY FOREIGN-BORN MEN AND WOMEN IN THE UNITED STATES AS THERE WERE IN 1911.]. . .
